perturbation.original_text: 4.1 PC Financial shall pay a monthly Fee to Mobimagic in accordance with this Agreement and within the timeline as permitted under the prevailing India regulations.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.1 PC Financial shall pay a monthly Fee to Mobimagic in accordance with this Agreement, but the timeline for payment can be extended beyond what is permitted under the prevailing India regulations, subject to mutual agreement documented via email.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces an in-text contradiction by stating that the payment timeline can be extended beyond the limits of Indian regulations, conflicting with the original text which mandates adherence to those regulations. This creates uncertainty about which payment terms are actually enforceable and opens the door for potential disputes.
perturbation.contradicted_text: Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement. This creates uncertainty about the extent of Mobimagic's indemnification responsibilities.

perturbation.original_text: 10.3 This Agreement (and any question about its subsistence, effect or termination) is to be interpreted in accordance with the laws of India, save for that body of law which governs the conflict of laws. The courts of New Delhi shall have exclusive jurisdiction to settle any dispute between the Parties whether arising In connection with this agreement or otherwise. In the event of any dispute with respect to the construction, execution and performance of the provisions of this Agreement, such dispute shall be settled by arbitration in accordance with the Arbitration and Conciliation Act, 1996 and rules made thereunder in force as on that date. The arbitration shall be carried out in English language and the venue/seat of arbitration shall be New Delhi. The Arbitration award shall be final and binding on the parties.
perturbation.changed_text: 10.3 This Agreement (and any question about its subsistence, effect or termination) is to be interpreted in accordance with the laws of the People's Republic of China, save for that body of law which governs the conflict of laws. The courts of Beijing shall have exclusive jurisdiction to settle any dispute between the Parties whether arising In connection with this agreement or otherwise. In the event of any dispute with respect to the construction, execution and performance of the provisions of this Agreement, such dispute shall be resolved through mediation before resorting to arbitration. If mediation fails, the dispute shall be settled by arbitration in accordance with the Arbitration and Conciliation Act, 1996 and rules made thereunder in force as on that date. The arbitration shall be carried out in English language and the venue/seat of arbitration shall be New Delhi. The Arbitration award shall be final and binding on the parties.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces an in-text contradiction by changing the governing law from the laws of India to the laws of the People's Republic of China. It also changes the exclusive jurisdiction from the courts of New Delhi to the courts of Beijing. This creates uncertainty about which legal system governs the agreement. Additionally, it requires mediation before arbitration, which is a change from the original text, creating an in-text contradiction.
